title: (x) Rock Runt Riket 1987 - (similar to) Railroad Gothic {Adriano S}
content:
Also (hope I'm not abusing starting 2 threads in a row?) I was looking to identify this other font (fonts?):   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221834im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/28182.gif)   
   
Thank you once more.
author: ssmm

comments.content: Actually, it isn't. The 'A' is different.

Ok, here is Railroad Gothic along with the original sample:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221834im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/28185.gif)

[Headline 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221834/http:/www.cthulhulives.org/toybox/PROPDOCS/PropFonts.html) (scroll down the page) is another possibility. It's free, so at least it won't cost anything to try it out.

Nice find, Chesh.   
   
Veer was giving RR Railroad Gothic for free too, that's where I got it ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221834im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Railroad Gothic was also the best match I had came across... If it just wasn't for the "A", yes... Then again, Cheshire Dave's suggestion, Headline One, hmm, it actually looks to be farther from matching... (Also, dates don't match, as that font is from 2002, whereas the sample pic is from 1987... Now, the text on the side, "Headline One is a replica of real newspaper headline type", that brings up some interest...) Well, could it be that it was some previous version of Railroad Gothic maybe?...
Judging by the date of the sample, it's likely that it is a pre-digital version of Railroad Gothic.
